cards.name: Akroma, Angel of Wrath
cards.text: Whenever a creature enters the battlefield under your control, it gains two abilities chosen at random from flying, first strike, trample, haste, protection from black, protection from red, and vigilance.
cards.originalText: Whenever a creature enters the battlefield under your control, it gains two of the following abilities chosen at random: flying, first strike, trample, haste, protection from black, protection from red, and vigilance.
cards.flavor: No rest. No mercy. No matter what.

foreignNames.name: 怒りの天使アクローマ

cards.name: Arcanis, the Omnipotent
cards.text: {X}, Return a creature you control with converted mana cost X to its owner's hand: Draw a number of cards chosen at random between 0 and X. X can't be 0.
cards.originalText: {X}, Return a creature you control with converted mana cost X to its owner's hand: Draw a number of cards chosen at random between 0 and X. X can't be 0.
cards.flavor: Do not concern yourself with my origin, my race, or my ancestry. Seek my record in the pits, and then make your wager.

cards.name: Arcbound Overseer
cards.text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may put a +1/+1 counter on target creature you control.

At the beginning of your upkeep, you may put a charge counter on target permanent you control.
cards.originalText:
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may put a +1/+1 counter on target creature you control.

At the beginning of your upkeep, you may put a charge counter on target permanent you control.

cards.name: Ashling the Pilgrim
cards.text: {2}: Ashling the Pilgrim Avatar deals 1 damage to each creature and each player.
cards.originalText: {2}: Ashling the Pilgrim deals 1 damage to each creature and each player.

cards.name: Ashling, the Extinguisher
cards.text: {5}: Destroy all nonland permanents. Activate this ability only once and only during your turn.
cards.originalText: {5}: Destroy all nonland permanents. Activate this ability only once and only during your turn.
cards.flavor: The Aurora had transformed her into a relentless force of destruction.

foreignNames.name: 鎮める者、アシュリング

cards.name: Ashnod
cards.text: Whenever a creature deals damage to you, destroy it.
cards.originalText: Whenever a creature successfully damages you, destroy it.
cards.flavor: Ashnod served as Mishra's confidante while he led Fallaji weapons development before the Brothers' War. Whereas Mishra works in metals and stone, however, Ashnod works in living flesh. She sees all living things as prototype machines; her "improvements" to them make her as feared by allies as by enemies.

cards.name: Barrin
cards.text: Sacrifice a permanent: Return target creature to its owner's hand.
cards.originalText: You may sacrifice a permanent to return any creature to its owner's hand. Play this ability as an instant.
cards.flavor: An old and powerful wizard living on the mysterious isle of Tolaria, Barrin is the teacher who trained the young Ertai. He is also Hanna's father, but for reasons known only to the two of them neither acknowledges the other—or their strained relationship.

cards.name: Birds of Paradise
cards.text: Lands you control have "{T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool."
cards.originalText: Lands you control have "{T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool."
cards.flavor: Long ago, birds of paradise littered the skies. Thanks to the city's sprawl, most now exist as pets of society's elite.

cards.name: Birds of Paradise
cards.text: Lands you control have "{T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool."
cards.originalText: Lands you control have "{T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool."
cards.flavor: Long ago, birds of paradise littered the skies. Thanks to the city's sprawl, most now exist as pets of society's elite.

cards.name: Bosh, Iron Golem
cards.text: {X}, Sacrifice an artifact with converted mana cost X: Bosh, Iron Golem Avatar deals X damage to target creature or player.
cards.originalText: {X}, Sacrifice an artifact with converted mana cost X: Bosh, Iron Golem deals X damage to target creature or player.
cards.flavor: As Glissa searches for the truth about Memnarch, Bosh searches to unearth the secrets buried deep in his memory.

foreignNames.name: 鉄のゴーレム、ボッシュ

cards.name: Braids, Conjurer Adept
cards.text:
{2}: Each player may put a land card from his or her hand onto the battlefield tapped.

{3}: Each player may put a noncreature artifact card from his or her hand onto the battlefield.

{4}: Each player may put a creature card from his or her hand onto the battlefield. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.
cards.originalText:
{2}: Each player may put a land card from his or her hand onto the battlefield tapped.

{3}: Each player may put a noncreature artifact card from his or her hand onto the battlefield.

{4}: Each player may put a creature card from his or her hand onto the battlefield. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.
cards.flavor: The rifted multiverse became a sea of conflciting realities, each peopled by possible versions of every living being.

cards.name: Chronatog
cards.text:
You have no maximum hand size.

{0}: Draw three cards. You skip your next turn. Activate this ability only once each turn.
cards.originalText:
You have no maximum hand size.

{0}: Draw three cards. You skip your next turn. Activate this ability only once each turn.
cards.flavor: For the chronatog, there is no meal like the present.

cards.name: Crovax
cards.text: Whenever a creature you control deals damage to a creature or player, you gain 1 life.
cards.originalText: Whenever any of your creatures damages any creature or player, gain 1 life.
cards.flavor: How does one escape a curse? For Crovax, a wealthy noble, the answer may lie in joining the crew of the Weatherlight as they seek to rescue their abducted captain Sisay.  Secretly, he hopes in his journeys to find Selenia, the angelic being who abandoned him and his family years ago.

cards.name: Dakkon Blackblade
cards.text: You may play any colored card from your hand as a copy of a basic land card chosen at random that can produce mana of one of the card's colors.
cards.originalText: You may play any colored card from your hand as a copy of a basic land card chosen at random that can produce mana of one of the card's colors.
cards.flavor: "My power is as vast as the plains, my strength is that of mountains. Each wave that crashes upon the shore thunders like blood in my veins." — Memoirs

cards.name: Dauntless Escort
cards.text: Creatures you control have exalted. (Whenever a creature you control attacks alone, it gets +1/+1 until end of turn for each instance of exalted among permanents you control.)
cards.originalText: Creatures you control have exalted.
cards.flavor: Elspeth's squires do not seek advancement. For them, no jknightly glory could surpass the glory of serving their champion.

cards.name: Diamond Faerie
cards.text: {S}: Target creature you control gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
cards.originalText: : Target creature you control gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: "That such delicate creatures could become so powerful in the embrace of winter is yet more proof that I am right." — Heidar, Rimewind Master

foreignNames.name: ダイアモンドのフェアリー

cards.name: Eight-and-a-Half-Tails
cards.text: {1}: Until end of turn, target permanent you control gains protection from a color chosen at random from colors it doesn't have protection from.
cards.originalText: {1}: Until end of turn, target permanent you control gains protection from a color chosen at random from colors it doesn't have protection from.
cards.flavor: Virtue is an inner light that can prevail in every soul.

cards.name: Eladamri
cards.text: {0}: The next 1 damage that would be dealt to target creature you control is dealt to you instead.
cards.originalText: You may redirect to yourself any amount of damage dealt to creatures you control.
cards.flavor: Proud, shrewd, and charismatic, Eladamri has a commitment to his people that is absolute. The guerilla war he wages against Volrath has convinced him that the only way to liberate the Skyshroud elves is to lead all Rath's refugees to freedom. So be it.

cards.name: Eladamri, Lord of Leaves
cards.text: At the beginning of each player's precombat main phase, that player adds {G}{G} to his or her mana pool.
cards.originalText: At the beginning of each player's precombat main phase, that player adds {G}{G} to his or her mana pool.
cards.flavor: "We have been patient. We have planned our attack. We are ready... now." — Eladamri, Lord of Leaves

cards.name: Elvish Champion
cards.text: You begin the game with a 1/1 green Elf creature token on the battlefield. It has "{T}: Add {G} to your mana pool."
cards.originalText: You begin the game with a 1/1 green Elf creature token on the battlefield that has "{T}: Add {G} to your mana pool."
cards.flavor: "For what are leaves but countless blades to fight a countless foe on high" — Elvish hymn

foreignNames.name: エルフのチャンピオン

cards.name: Enigma Sphinx
cards.text: Whenever you cast a colored artifact spell for the first time in a turn, search your library for a colored artifact card chosen at random whose converted mana cost is less than that spell's converted mana cost. You may play that card without paying its mana cost. If you don't, put that card on the bottom of your library.
cards.originalText: Whenever you cast a colored artifact spell for the first time in a turn, search your library for a colored artifact card chosen at random whose converted mana cost is less than that spell's converted mana cost. You may cast that card without paying its mana cost. If you don't, put that card on the bottom of your library.

cards.name: Erhnam Djinn
cards.text: Whenever you cast a creature spell, put a 1/1 green Saproling creature token onto the battlefield.
cards.originalText: Whenever you cast a creature spell, put a 1/1 green Saproling creature token onto the battlefield.
cards.flavor: He provides a safe path to nowhere.

cards.name: Erhnam Djinn
cards.text: Whenever you cast a creature spell, put a 1/1 green Saproling creature token onto the battlefield.
cards.originalText: Whenever you cast a creature spell, put a 1/1 green Saproling creature token onto the battlefield.
cards.flavor: He provides a safe path to nowhere.

cards.name: Ertai
cards.text: Creatures you control have hexproof. (They can't be the targets of spells or abilities your opponents control.)
cards.originalText: Your creatures can't be the target of your opponents' spells or abilities.
cards.flavor: After serving his apprenticeship under Barrin of Tolaria, Ertai graced the Weatherlight crew with his presence as the ship's "resident" wizard. He realizes that few recognize his greatness—but then how could they, when they lack his insight and wisdom?

cards.name: Etched Oracle
cards.text: You may pay {W}{U}{B}{R}{G} rather than pay the mana cost for spells that you cast.
cards.originalText: You may pay {W}{U}{B}{R}{G} rather than pay the mana cost for spells that you cast.

cards.name: Fallen Angel
cards.text: Whenever a creature you control dies, target opponent loses 1 life and you gain 1 life.
cards.originalText: Whenever a creature you control is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, target opponent loses 1 life and you gain 1 life.
cards.flavor: Why do you weep for the dead? I rejoice, for they have died for me.

cards.name: Figure of Destiny
cards.text: {X}: Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature with fewer than X +1/+1 counters on it.
cards.originalText: {X}: Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature with fewer than X +1/+1 counters on it.

cards.name: Flametongue Kavu
cards.text: Whenever a nontoken creature enters the battlefield under your control, that creature deals X damage to target creature, where X is a number chosen at random from 0 to 4.
cards.originalText: Whenever a nontoken creature enters the battlefield under your control, that creature deals X damage to target creature, where X is a number chosen at random from 0 to 4.
cards.flavor: "For dim-witted, thick-skulled genetic mutants, they have pretty good aim." — Sisay

cards.name: Frenetic Efreet
cards.text:
Each permanent you control has phasing. (It phases in or out before you untap during each of your untap steps. While it's phased out, it's treated as though it doesn't exist.)

At the beginning of your end step, flip a coin. If you win the flip, take an extra turn after this one.
cards.originalText:
Permanents you control have phasing.

At the beginning of your end step, flip a coin. If you win the flip, take an extra turn after this one.

cards.name: Gerrard
cards.text: At the beginning of your draw step, draw an additional card.
cards.originalText: During your draw phase, draw an additional card.
cards.flavor: Soldier. Adventurer. Heir to the Legacy. Gerrard has, over the years, traveled much of Dominaria in search of fortune and glory. Now, after serving nobly in the Benalish army, he has returned to the Weatherlight to serve as captain in Sisay's absence and to take up the battle against the Lord of the Wastes.

cards.name: Gix
cards.text: {3}: Return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
cards.originalText: {3}: Return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
cards.flavor: Through ruthlessness and raw ambition, Gix rose through the Phyrexian regime to the exalted rank of praetor. Even while overseeing many of Phyrexia's most important undertakings, Gix continues his own quest for supremacy . . . for in Phyrexia, the weak become fodder for the strong.

cards.name: Goblin Warchief
cards.text: Attacking creatures you control get +1/+0.
cards.originalText: Attacking creatures you control get +1/+0.
cards.flavor: They poured from the Skirk Ridge like lava, burning and devouring everything in their path.

cards.name: Goblin Warchief
cards.text: Attacking creatures you control get +1/+0.
cards.originalText: Attacking creatures you control get +1/+0.
cards.flavor: They poured from the Skirk Ridge like lava, burning and devouring everything in their path.

cards.name: Greven il-Vec
cards.text: Whenever a creature you control deals damage to a creature, destroy the other creature. It can't be regenerated.
cards.originalText: Whenever any of your creatures damages any creature, bury the damaged creature.
cards.flavor: As a ruthless leader for Volrath, Greven il-Vec serves his lord by commanding the flying ship Predator. Greven has attained his powerful rank through a series of underhanded schemes and assassinations, the majority of which were blessed by Volrath himself.

cards.name: Grinning Demon
cards.text: Whenever a nontoken creature you control dies, target opponent discards a card.
cards.originalText: Whenever a nontoken creature you control is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, target opponent discards a card.
cards.flavor: It's drawn to the scent of screaming.

cards.name: Grinning Demon
cards.text: Whenever a nontoken creature you control dies, target opponent discards a card.
cards.originalText: Whenever a nontoken creature you control is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, target opponent discards a card.
cards.flavor: It's drawn to the scent of screaming.

cards.name: Haakon, Stromgald Scourge
cards.text:
Pay 1 life: You may play target creature card in your graveyard this turn.

Whenever you play a creature card from your graveyard, it becomes a black Zombie Knight.

If a Zombie Knight would be put into your graveyard from the battlefield, exile it instead.
cards.originalText:
Pay 1 life: You may play target creature card in your graveyard this turn.

Whenever you play a creature card from your graveyard, it becomes a black Zombie Knight.

If a Zombie Knight would be put into your graveyard from the battlefield, exile it instead.

foreignNames.name: ストロームガルドの災い魔、ハーコン

cards.name: Hanna
cards.text: Spells you cast cost {1} less to cast.
cards.originalText: Your spells cost {1} less to play.
cards.flavor: Educated in Argive and highly knowledgeable in the field of artifacts, this expert navigator of the Weatherlight believes that scholarship does not necessarily lead to understanding. Her diligence in pursuing both is her greatest asset.

cards.name: Heartwood Storyteller
cards.text:
The first creature spell you cast each turn costs {1} less to cast.

The first noncreature spell each opponent casts each turn costs {1} more to cast.
cards.originalText:
The first creature spell you cast each turn costs {1} less to cast.

The first noncreature spell each opponent casts each turn costs {1} more to cast.
cards.flavor: His roots reach deep, nurtured not by soil and rain, but by millennia of experience.

foreignNames.name: ハートウッドの語り部

cards.name: Hell's Caretaker
cards.text: {3}, Sacrifice a creature: Return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield.
cards.originalText: {3}, Sacrifice a creature: Return target creature card from your graveyard to the battlefield.
cards.flavor: You might leave here, Chenndra, should another take your place...

cards.name: Hermit Druid
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, put a land card from your library chosen at random onto the battlefield.
cards.originalText: At the beginning of your upkeep, put a land card from your library chosen at random onto the battlefield.
cards.flavor: Seeking the company of plants ensures that your wits will go to seed.

cards.name: Higure, the Still Wind
cards.text: Whenever a nontoken creature you control deals combat damage to an opponent, choose a creature card at random from your library, reveal that card, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.
cards.originalText: Whenever a nontoken creature you control deals combat damage to an opponent, choose a creature card at random from your library, reveal that card, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Ink-Eyes, Servant of Oni
cards.text:
At the beginning of the game, look at target opponent's hand and choose a nonland card from it. That player discards that card.

{X}, Pay X life: Put target creature card with converted mana cost X from an opponent's graveyard onto the battlefield under your control.
cards.originalText:
At the beginning of the game, look at target opponent's hand and choose a nonland card from it. That player discards that card.

{X}, Pay X life: Put target creature card with converted mana cost X in an opponent's graveyard onto the battlefield under your control.

foreignNames.name: Occhi di Pece, Serva di Oni
Ojos de tinta, sierva de oni

cards.name: Jaya Ballard
cards.text: {X}: Jaya Ballard Avatar deals an amount of damage chosen at random from 0 to X to target creature or player. Activate this ability only once each turn.
cards.originalText: {X}: Jaya Ballard deals an amount of damage chosen at random from 0 to X to target creature or player. Activate this ability only once each turn.

cards.name: Jhoira of the Ghitu
cards.text:
{3}, Discard a card: Copy three instant cards chosen at random. You may cast one of the copies without paying its mana cost.

{3}, Discard a card: Copy three sorcery cards chosen at random. You may cast one of the copies without paying its mana cost. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.
cards.originalText:
{3}, Discard a card: Copy three instant cards chosen at random. You may cast one of the copies without paying its mana cost.

{3}, Discard a card: Copy three sorcery cards chosen at random. You may cast one of the copies without paying its mana cost. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.

cards.name: Karn
cards.text: Each noncreature artifact you control is an artifact creature with power and toughness each equal to its converted mana cost.
cards.originalText: Each of your noncreature artifacts is also an artifact creature with power and toughness each equal to its total casting cost.
cards.flavor: Both part of the Legacy and an individual in his own right, the silver golem Karn is haunted by a single, terrible incident: while serving to protect the young Gerrard, Karn accidentally took the life of another. Wakened from years spent as a statue, the golem has vowed to never kill again as he rejoins Gerrard.

cards.name: Karona, False God
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, exchange control of a permanent you control chosen at random and a permanent target opponent controls chosen at random.
cards.originalText: At the beginning of your upkeep, exchange control of a permanent you control chosen at random and a permanent target opponent controls chosen at random.

cards.name: Kresh the Bloodbraided
cards.text: Whenever a creature you control is devoured, put an X/X green Ooze creature token onto the battlefield, where X is the devoured creature's power.
cards.originalText: Whenever a creature you control is devoured, put an X/X green Ooze creature token onto the battlefield, where X is the devoured creature's power.
cards.flavor: Each of his twenty-two braids is bound with bone and leather from a foe.

cards.name: Loxodon Hierarch
cards.text: Sacrifice a permanent: Regenerate target creature you control.
cards.originalText: Sacrifice a permanent: Regenerate target creature you control.
cards.flavor: I have lived long, and I remember how this city once was. If my death serves to bring back the Ravnica in my memory, then so be it.

cards.name: Lyna
cards.text: Creatures you control have shadow. (They can block and be blocked only by creatures with shadow.)
cards.originalText: All creatures you control gain shadow. (Those creatures can block and be blocked only by creatures with shadow.)
cards.flavor: One of the few Soltari who can cross the shadow barrier, Lyna serves as an emissary to the outside world. A quick thinker and convincing speaker, she does whatever she can to lead her people out of the shadows and into substance.

cards.name: Lyzolda, the Blood Witch
cards.text:
Hellbent — As long as you have no cards in hand, if a source you control would deal damage to a creature or player, it deals double that damage to that creature or player instead.

Hellbent — At the beginning of your end step, if you have no cards in hand, each of your opponents discards a card.
cards.originalText:
Hellbent — As long as you have no cards in hand, if a source you control would deal damage to a creature or player, it deals double that damage to that creature or player instead.

Hellbent — At the beginning of your end step, if you have no cards in hand, each of your opponents discards a card.
cards.flavor: Sacrificial rites take place before an audience of cheerign cultists, each begging to be the next on stage.

cards.name: Maelstrom Archangel
cards.text: At end of combat, for each creature you controlled at the time it dealt combat damage to a player this turn, copy a random card with the same mana cost as that creature. You may pay {3}. If you do, choose one of those copies. If a copy of a permanent card is chosen, you may put a token onto the battlefield that's a copy of that card. If a copy of an instant or sorcery card is chosen, you may cast the copy without paying its mana cost.
cards.originalText: At end of combat, for each creature you controlled at the time it dealt combat damage to a player this turn, copy a random card with the same mana cost as that creature. You may pay {3}. If you do, choose one of those copies. If a copy of a permanent card is chosen, you may put a token onto the battlefield that's a copy of that card. If a copy of an instant or sorcery card is chosen, you may cast the copy without paying its mana cost.

cards.name: Malfegor
cards.text:
Whenever a creature enters the battlefield under your control, if it was unearthed, it gets +3/+0.

Whenever a creature you control is exiled, if it was unearthed, shuffle that card into its owner's library.
cards.originalText:
Whenever a creature enters the battlefield under your control, if it was unearthed, it gets +3/+0.

Whenever a creature you control is exiled, if it was unearthed, shuffle that card into its owner's library.
cards.flavor: The blood of the demons quickened as their master rose over the battlefield. The blood of the angels also quickened: here was the chance to finally end the war started millennia ago.

cards.name: Maralen of the Mornsong
cards.text:
At the beginning of the game, you may pay any amount of life.

You can't draw cards.

At the beginning of your draw step, look at the top X cards of your library, where X is the amount of life paid with Maralen of the Mornsong Avatar. Put one of them into your hand, then shuffle your library.
cards.originalText:
At the beginning of the game, you may pay any amount of life.

You can't draw cards.

At the beginning of your draw step, look at the top X cards of your library, where X is the amount of life paid with Maralen of the Mornsong. Put one of them into your hand, then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Maraxus
cards.text: Creatures you control get +1/+0.
cards.originalText: Your creatures get +1/+0.
cards.flavor: Too chaotic for even the other warlords of Keld, Maraxus has devoted himself to serving as a hired killer for the sinister Volrath. A man fond of his work, he's more than willing to put in those extra hours needed to perfect his craft.

cards.name: Maro
cards.text: Tap an untapped creature you control, Discard a card: Target creature you control gets +X/+X until end of turn, where X is the number of cards in your hand.
cards.originalText: Tap an untapped creature you control, Discard a card: Target creature you control gets +X/+X until end of turn, where X is the number of cards in your hand.
cards.flavor: No two see the same Maro.

cards.name: Master of the Wild Hunt
cards.text: {2}{G}: Put a green creature token onto the battlefield that's a 2/2 Wolf, a 2/3 Antelope with forestwalk, a 3/2 Cat with shroud, or a 4/4 green Rhino with trample, chosen at random.
cards.originalText: {2}{G}: Put a green creature token onto the battlefield that's a 2/2 Wolf, a 2/3 Antelope with forestwalk, a 3/2 Cat with shroud, or a 4/4 green Rhino with trample, chosen at random.

cards.name: Mayael the Anima
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, reveal the top card of your library. If it's a creature card with power 5 or greater, put it into your hand. Otherwise, you may put it on the bottom of your library.
cards.originalText: At the beginning of your upkeep, reveal the top card of your library. If it's a creature card with power 5 or greater, put it into your hand. Otherwise, you may put it on the bottom of your library.
cards.flavor: The sacred Anima's eyes are blind to all but the grandest truths.

cards.name: Mirri
cards.text: If a basic land you control is tapped for mana, it produces mana of a color of your choice instead of any other type.
cards.originalText: Each of your basic lands may be tapped to produce any color of mana instead of its normal type.
cards.flavor: Mirri and Gerrard have been the best of friends since they trained together under the maro-sorcerer Multani. A fierce and agile warrior, she rejoined Gerrard aboard the Weatherlight as his unofficial first mate shortly after he assumed command of the flying ship.

cards.name: Mirri the Cursed
cards.text: Creatures you control have "{T}: Another target creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn. Put a +1/+1 counter on this creature."
cards.originalText: Creatures you control have "{T}: Another target creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn. Put a +1/+1 counter on this creature."
cards.flavor: A hero fails, a martyr falls. Time twists and destinies interchange.

cards.name: Mirror Entity
cards.text: {X}: Choose a creature type. Until end of turn, creatures you control of the chosen type become X/X and gain all creature types.
cards.originalText: {X}: Choose a creature type. Until end of turn, creatures you control of the chosen type become X/X and gain all creature types.
cards.flavor: Unaware of Lorwyn's diversity, it sees only itself, refelected a thousand times over.

cards.name: Mishra
cards.text: If a creature you control would deal damage, it deals double that damage instead.
cards.originalText: Double all damage dealt by creatures you control.
cards.flavor: Both complement and antithesis to his older brother Urza, Mishra also mastered the intricacies of artifice. It was Mishra's strength that first gave rise to the massive Phyrexian war engines on Dominaria, and it was his weakness that pushed him, Urza, and Dominaria itself to the point of annihilation.

cards.name: Momir Vig, Simic Visionary
cards.text: {X}, Discard a card: Put a token onto the battlefield that's a copy of a creature card with converted mana cost X chosen at random. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery and only once each turn.
cards.originalText: {X}, Discard a card: Put a token onto the battlefield that's a copy of a creature card with converted mana cost X chosen at random. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery and only once each turn.

foreignNames.name: シミックの幻想家、モミール・ヴィグ

cards.name: Morinfen
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, you lose 1 life for each permanent you control.
cards.originalText: At the beginning of your upkeep, you lose 1 life for each permanent you control.
cards.flavor: "I looked into its eyes, and its soul was so empty I saw no reflection, no light there." — Crovax

cards.name: Multani
cards.text: Creatures you control get +X/+0, where X is the number of cards in your hand.
cards.originalText: All creatures you control get +X/+0, where X is the number of cards in your hand.
cards.flavor: In mentoring apprentice mages, the forest spirit Multani teaches each to respect nature while making use of its gifts. Multani taught Gerrard, Mirri, and Rofellos to hone their spellcasting in tandem with more physical disciplines so that both would be improved.

cards.name: Murderous Redcap
cards.text: Whenever a creature enters the battlefield under your control with a counter on it, you may have it deal damage equal to its power to target creature or player.
cards.originalText: Whenever a creature enters the battlefield under your control with a counter on it, you may have it deal damage equal to its power to target creature or player.

foreignNames.name: 残忍なレッドキャップ

cards.name: Necropotence
cards.text:
Skip your draw step.

At the beginning of your end step, if it's not the first turn of the game, put a death counter on Necropotence Avatar. You draw X cards and you lose X life, where X is the number of death counters on Necropotence Avatar.
cards.originalText:
Skip your draw step.

At the beginning of your end step, if it's not the first turn of the game, put a death counter on Necropotence. You draw X cards and you lose X life, where X is the number of death counters on Necropotence.

cards.name: Nekrataal
cards.text: Creature spells you cast cost {B} less to cast. This effect reduces only the amount of colored mana you pay.
cards.originalText: Creature spells you cast cost {B} less to cast. This effect reduces only the amount of colored mana you pay.
cards.flavor: "I have seen the horrors Kaervek has freed. My betrayal is certain - but of Kaervek or of Jamuraa, I cannot say." — Jolrael

cards.name: Oni of Wild Places
cards.text:
Creatures you control have haste.

At the beginning of your upkeep, return a creature you control to its owner's hand.
cards.originalText:
Creatures you control have haste.

At the beginning of your upkeep, return a creature you control to its owner's hand.
cards.flavor: The oni leapt easily from peak to peak, toying with its victims, its voice a purry frmo the rumbling depths of nightmare.

cards.name: Oracle
cards.text: {0}: Untap target attacking creature you control and remove it from combat.
cards.originalText: You may untap any attacking creatures you control and remove them from combat.
cards.flavor: Known simply by her title, Oracle uses her gift of prophecy to aid her people. She believes Gerrard to be the Korvecdal, the one who will unite the people of Rath against Volrath's tyranny. Her only doubt is whether she will be strong enough to guide him to his destiny.

cards.name: Orcish Squatters
cards.text: At the beginning of your precombat main phase, add {X} to your mana pool, where X is the number of lands target opponent controls.
cards.originalText: At the beginning of your precombat main phase, add {X} to your mana pool, where X is the number of lands target opponent controls.

cards.name: Orim
cards.text: Creatures you control have reach.
cards.originalText: Your creatures can block as though they had flying.
cards.flavor: Trained in the Samite arts, Orim serves as the healer aboard the Weatherlight. She is quick with languages and was educated at the same Argivian university as Hanna. A student by nature, Orim keeps a diary of all her new discoveries—both physical and spiritual—during her travels.

cards.name: Peacekeeper
cards.text: {3}: For each opponent who controls a creature, put a token onto the battlefield that's a copy of a card named Arrest and attach it to a creature that player controls chosen at random.
cards.originalText: {3}: For each opponent who controls a creature, put a token onto the battlefield that's a copy of a card named Arrest and attach it to a creature that player controls chosen at random.
cards.flavor: "I have always imagined my mother as such a woman, strong and wise." — Sisay, journal

cards.name: Phage the Untouchable
cards.text:
Pay 1 life: Until end of turn, whenever a creature deals combat damage to you, destroy that creature.

Pay 1 life: Until end of turn, whenever target creature you control deals combat damage to a creature, destroy the damaged creature.
cards.originalText:
Pay 1 life: Until end of turn, whenever a creature deals combat damage to you, destroy that creature.

Pay 1 life: Until end of turn, whenever target creature you control deals combat damage to a creature, destroy the damaged creature.

foreignNames.name: 触れられざる者フェイジ

cards.name: Platinum Angel
cards.text: If you control an artifact, a creature, an enchantment, and a land, you can't lose the game and your opponents can't win the game.
cards.originalText: If you control an artifact, a creature, an enchantment, and a land, you can't lose the game and your opponents can't win the game.
cards.flavor: In its heart lies the secret of immortality.

cards.name: Platinum Angel
cards.text: If you control an artifact, a creature, an enchantment, and a land, you can't lose the game and your opponents can't win the game.
cards.originalText: If you control an artifact, a creature, an enchantment, and a land, you can't lose the game and your opponents can't win the game.
cards.flavor: In its heart lies the secret of immortality.

cards.name: Prodigal Sorcerer
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, look at the top card of your library. You may put that card into your graveyard.
cards.originalText: At the beginning of your upkeep, look at the top card of your library. You may put that card into your graveyard.
cards.flavor: Ocassionally, members of the Institute of Arcane Study acquire a taste for worldy pleasures. Seldom do they have trouble finding employment.

cards.name: Prodigal Sorcerer
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, look at the top card of your library. You may put that card into your graveyard.
cards.originalText: At the beginning of your upkeep, look at the top card of your library. You may put that card into your graveyard.
cards.flavor: He wastes his amazing talents on proving how amazing he really is.

cards.name: Raksha Golden Cub
cards.text:
Creatures you control get +0/+1.

Equipped creatures you control get +1/+0 and have first strike.
cards.originalText:
Creatures you control get +0/+1.

Equipped creatures you control get +1/+0 and have first strike.
cards.flavor: Some believe that Raksha, yougnest of the kha, is the reincarnation of Dakan, the first and mightiest of leonin leaders.

cards.name: Reaper King
cards.text: Each creature you control gets +1/+1 for each of its colors.
cards.originalText: Each creature you control gets +1/+1 for each of its colors.
cards.flavor: It's harvest time.

cards.name: Rith, the Awakener
cards.text: Whenever a creature you control deals combat damage to a player, you may pay {5}. If you do, put a 5/5 red Dragon creature token with flying onto the battlefield.
cards.originalText: Whenever a creature you control deals combat damage to a player, you may pay {5}. If you do, put a 5/5 red Dragon creature token with flying onto the battlefield.

cards.name: Rith, the Awakener
cards.text: Whenever a creature you control deals combat damage to a player, you may pay {5}. If you do, put a 5/5 red Dragon creature token with flying onto the battlefield.
cards.originalText: Whenever a creature you control deals combat damage to a player, you may pay {5}. If you do, put a 5/5 red Dragon creature token with flying onto the battlefield.

cards.name: Rofellos
cards.text: Whenever a creature you control dies, draw a card.
cards.originalText: Whenever a creature you control is put into a graveyard from play, draw a card.
cards.flavor: Gerrard's longtime friend and fellow student under the maro-sorcerer Multani, Rofellos is an excellent warrior and excellent company. Though adept at both magic and swordplay, he's far more comfortable with a flagon in his hand and a good companion at his side.

cards.name: Royal Assassin
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, you draw a card and you lose 1 life.
cards.originalText: At the beginning of your upkeep, you draw a card and you lose 1 life.
cards.flavor: Trained in the arts of stealth, royal assassins choose their victims carefully, relying on timing and precision rather than brute force.

cards.name: Royal Assassin
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, you draw a card and you lose 1 life.
cards.originalText: At the beginning of your upkeep, you draw a card and you lose 1 life.
cards.flavor: Trained in the arts of stealth, royal assassins choose their victims carefully, relying on timing and precision rather than brute force.

cards.name: Rumbling Slum
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, Rumbling Slum Avatar deals 1 damage to each opponent.
cards.originalText: At the beginning of your upkeep, Rumbling Slum deals 1 damage to each opponent.
cards.flavor: The Orzhov contract the Izzet to animate slum districts and banish them to the wastes. The Gruul adopt them and send them back to the city for vengeance.

cards.name: Sakashima the Impostor
cards.text: {2}: Choose a creature you control. It becomes a copy of target creature except for its name.
cards.originalText: {2}: Choose a creature you control. It becomes a copy of target creature except for its name.

cards.name: Selenia
cards.text: Creatures you control have vigilance.
cards.originalText: Attacking doesn't cause your creatures to tap.
cards.flavor: Once a guardian of Crovax's estate, Selenia was freed from her magical bindings by the wealthy noble. Instead of remaining at his side, the angel chose to venture out into the world. For reasons unknown to Crovax, Selenia now serves the evil Volrath in his home realm of Rath.

cards.name: Serra
cards.text: Creatures you control get +0/+2.
cards.originalText: All creatures you control get +0/+2.
cards.flavor: Named for a benevolent goddess at birth, Serra fulfilled the prophecy of that goddess's coming. As a planeswalker, she embodies white mana and helps whole civilizations develop while both directly and indirectly inspiring countless individuals to be steadfast and strong in the service of light.

cards.name: Serra Angel
cards.text: Whenever you cast a spell, you gain 2 life.
cards.originalText: Whenever you cast a spell, you gain 2 life.
cards.flavor: Her sword sings more beautifully than any choir.

cards.name: Serra Angel
cards.text: Whenever you cast a spell, you gain 2 life.
cards.originalText: Whenever you cast a spell, you gain 2 life.
cards.flavor: Her sword sings more beautifully than any choir.

cards.name: Seshiro the Anointed
cards.text: At the beginning of the game, choose a creature type. Creatures you control, creature spells you control, and creature cards you own in any zone other than  the battlefield or the stack have the chosen type in addition to their other types.
cards.originalText: At the beginning of the game, choose a creature type. Creatures you control, creature spells you control, and creature cards you own in any zone other than  the battlefield or the stack have the chosen type in addition to their other types.
cards.flavor: His family was the first to reach out to the human monks. He soon knew as many koans as he did blade strikes.

cards.name: Sidar Kondo
cards.text: {3}: Target creature gets +3/+3 until end of turn.
cards.originalText: {3}: Target creature gets +3/+3 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: Kondo served as guardian to the infant Gerrard and raised him alongside his own son, Vuel. He taught both boys to be strong and to lead, but whereas Gerrard became a champion of honor, Vuel's bitterness led him to become an equally devastating force of malice.

cards.name: Sisay
cards.text: Whenever you tap a land for mana, add one mana to your mana pool of any type that land produced.
cards.originalText: Whenever you tap a land for mana, it produces one additional mana of the same type.
cards.flavor: While captain of the Weatherlight, Sisay undertook a quest for the Legacy, a collection of artifacts needed to defeat the Lord of the Wastes. She continued this quest even when Gerrard, heir to the Legacy, chose to abandon it. Sisay is devoted to the cause of good at whatever price.

cards.name: Sisters of Stone Death
cards.text:
Each creature you control must be blocked if able.

{4}: Exile target creature that's blocking a creature you control.
cards.originalText:
Each creature you control must be blocked if able.

{4}: Exile target creature that's blocking a creature you control.

foreignNames.name: Sœurs de la mort de pierre

cards.name: Sliver Queen
cards.text: Whenever you cast a non-Sliver creature spell, exile that spell. If you do, put a token onto the battlefield that's a copy of a random non-Shapeshifter Sliver creature card with the same converted mana cost as that spell.
cards.originalText: Whenever you cast a non-Sliver creature spell, exile that spell. If you do, put a token onto the battlefield that's a copy of a random non-Shapeshifter Sliver creature card with the same converted mana cost as that spell.
cards.flavor: Her children are ever part of her.

cards.name: Sliver Queen, Brood Mother
cards.text: {3}: Put a 1/1 colorless Sliver creature token onto the battlefield.
cards.originalText: {3}: Put a Sliver token into play. Treat this token as a 1/1 colorless creature.
cards.flavor: Though long held captive beneath Volrath's stronghold, the sliver queen is actually freer than most of Rath's denizens. Her maternal instincts always take precedence—even when they conflict with the evincar's agenda—and through her numerous litters, she ranges across all of Rath.

cards.name: Squee
cards.text: Your opponents play with their hands revealed.
cards.originalText: Your opponents play with their hands face up.
cards.flavor: The smartest—and only—goblin cabin boy aboard the Weatherlight, Squee has learned that intelligence and common sense are very different things. This matters little, however, since he has neither. Fortunately, he doesn't know what he's missing.

cards.name: Squee, Goblin Nabob
cards.text: {1}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to target creature you control this turn.
cards.originalText: {1}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to target creature you control this turn.
cards.flavor: "Some goblins are expendable. Some are impossible to get rid of. But he's both - at the same time!" — Starke

foreignNames.name: ゴブリンの太守スクイー

cards.name: Stalking Tiger
cards.text: Whenever you cast a creature spell, you may pay {1}. If you do, draw a card.
cards.originalText: Whenever you cast a creature spell, you may pay {1}. If you do, draw a card.
cards.flavor: Int he Jamuraan jungles, there is often no serpating beauty from danger.

cards.name: Starke
cards.text: At the beginning of your draw step, you may draw an additional card. If you do, put a card from your hand on the bottom of your library.
cards.originalText: During your draw phase, you may draw an additional card and then put any card in your hand on the bottom of your library.
cards.flavor: Starke believes in situational ethics—the situation determines the ethics. He's switched sides so often that he has become everyone's ally yet no one's friend. This former merchant of Rath accompanies the Weatherlight crew on their journey to his home world.

cards.name: Stonehewer Giant
cards.text: Whenever a creature enters the battlefield under your control, put a token onto the battlefield that's a copy of a random Equipment card with converted mana cost less than or equal to that creature's converted mana cost. Attach that Equipment to that creature.
cards.originalText: Whenever a creature enters the battlefield under your control, put a token onto the battlefield that's a copy of a random Equipment card with converted mana cost less than or equal to that creature's converted mana cost. Attach that Equipment to that creature.

cards.name: Stuffy Doll
cards.text: {0}: If damage would be dealt to you this turn by a source of your choice, prevent that damage. Stuffy Doll Avatar deals damage to you and target opponent equal to half the damage prevented this way, rounded up. Activate this ability only once each turn.
cards.originalText: {0}: If damage would be dealt to you this turn by a source of your choice, prevent that damage. Stuffy Doll deals damage to you and target opponent equal to half the damage prevented this way, rounded up. Activate this ability only once each turn.

cards.name: Tahngarth
cards.text: Creatures you control have haste.
cards.originalText: Your creatures are unaffected by summoning sickness.
cards.flavor: Tahngarth, first mate of the Weatherlight under Sisay, knows that there are really only two forms of life: the ugly ones and the minotaurs. A narcissist, he considers the condition of his hide as important as the accuracy of his blade.

cards.name: Takara
cards.text: Sacrifice a creature: Takara deals 1 damage to target creature or player.
cards.originalText: Sacrifice a creature: Takara deals 1 damage to target creature or player.
cards.flavor: Takara banishes the shadow of her father's ignoble reputation through the dedication, plain speaking, and swift action of a warrior. By refusing Starke's path of self-interest and opportunism, she has learned what he never will know: the value of sacrifice for a worthy cause.

cards.name: Tawnos
cards.text: You may cast artifact, creature, and enchantment spells as though they had flash.
cards.originalText: You may play artifact, creature, and enchantment spells any time you could play an instant.
cards.flavor: Tawnos brings a childlike wonder and an inherent skill to Urza's studio and bridges the wizardry of the workshop with the grandeur of the royal court. His speed and flexibility quickly earned him promotion from apprentice to master artificer.

cards.name: Teysa, Orzhov Scion
cards.text: Whenever a nontoken creature dies, put a 1/1 white Spirit creature token with flying onto the battlefield.
cards.originalText: Whenever a nontoken creature is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, put a 1/1 white Spirit creature token with flying onto the battlefield.

foreignNames.name: オルゾフの御曹子、テイサ

cards.name: Titania
cards.text: You may play an additional land on each of your turns.
cards.originalText: You may play an additional land each of your turns.
cards.flavor: Voice of the Argoth forest, defender of its creatures, and enforcer of its laws, Titania is literally an aspect of the forest itself. Her power and her very existence are linked to the land: when the forest is healthy, Titania is ascendant. When Argoth suffers, Titania also bleeds.

cards.name: Tradewind Rider
cards.text: {3}: Each player returns a permanent he or she controls to its owner's hand unless he or she pays 2 life.
cards.originalText: {3}: Each player returns a permanent he or she controls to its owner's hand unless he or she pays 2 life.
cards.flavor: It is said the wind will blow the world past if you wait long enough.

cards.name: Tradewind Rider
cards.text: {3}: Each player returns a permanent he or she controls to its owner's hand unless he or she pays 2 life.
cards.originalText: {3}: Each player returns a permanent he or she controls to its owner's hand unless he or she pays 2 life.
cards.flavor: It is said the wind will blow the world past if you wait long enough.

cards.name: Two-Headed Giant of Foriys
cards.text:
Each creature you control can block an additional creature each combat.

Each creature you control can't be blocked except by two or more creatures.
cards.originalText:
Each creature you control can block an additional creature each combat.

Each creature you control can't be blocked except by two or more creatures.
cards.flavor: None know if this Giant is the result of abberant magics, Siamese twins, or a mentalist's schizophrenia.

cards.name: Urza
cards.text: {3}: Urza deals 1 damage to target creature or player.
cards.originalText: {3}: Urza deals 1 damage to target creature or player.
cards.flavor: An artificer of unparalleled renown, Urza was a powerful cipher even before he was able to planeswalk. Seeing the world as a large, integrated machine is his greatest strength and weakness, enabling him to solve almost any problem but blinding him to his solutions' effects on others.

cards.name: Vampire Nocturnus
cards.text:
Play with the top card of your library revealed.

As long as the top card of your library is black, black creatures you control get +2/+1.
cards.originalText:
Play with the top card of your library revealed.

As long as the top card of your library is black, black creatures you control get +2/+1.
cards.flavor: "Your life with set with the sun."

cards.name: Viridian Zealot
cards.text: {2}, Sacrifice a creature: Destroy target artifact or enchantment. Search your library for a card with the same name as the sacrificed creature, reveal that card, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.
cards.originalText: {2}, Sacrifice a creature: Destroy target artifact or enchantment. Search your library for a card with the same name as the sacrificed creature, reveal that card, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.
cards.flavor: "I will fight only the way nature intended-and nature intended us to win."

foreignNames.name: ヴィリジアンの盲信者

cards.name: Volrath
cards.text: Whenever a creature you control is put into your graveyard from the battlefield, you may put it on top of your library.
cards.originalText: Whenever any of your creatures is put into your graveyard from play, you may put that creature on top of your library.
cards.flavor: The son of Gerrard's surrogate father, Sidar Kondo, Volrath stole Gerrard's Legacy and rose to power selling it off piece by piece. Now, he is an evincar, or agent, of the Lord of the Wastes. Armed with exceptional magical powers, he plots to conquer the entire multiverse.

cards.name: Xantcha
cards.text: Sacrifice a permanent: Regenerate target creature.
cards.originalText: Sacrifice a permanent: Regenerate target creature.
cards.flavor: A Phyrexian "sleeper agent," Xantcha has developed an inviolate sense of self. This aberration earned her a death sentence, but she was rescued by Urza and joined his crusade. Her Phyrexian credo of "Waste not, want not" has helped Urza more than even he comprehends.
